utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey. So where's Mon?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, she's at home, putting up decorations for Rachel's birthday party tonight.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And you're not helping?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I tried, but apparently singing "I will survive" in a helium voice - not helping.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey you guys!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Shhh don't say that loud, Gunther's gonna want to hug me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, good news everyone, we finally found a nanny. This is Molly . Molly, Chandler, Joey.

utterance.speaker: Joey and Chandler
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ooh, somebody's getting a little fussy.

utterance.content: You damn right I am, I've been waiting for a cookie for 7 minutes.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ok, you know what, I'm just gonna take her outside.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: No, you stay, I'll do it .

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: OK, thank you.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: Nice to meet you guys .

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, you too.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, wow, Molly is just great!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, Bravo on the hot nanny.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? You really think she's hot?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Are you kidding? If I wasn't married she'd be rejecting me right now.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And Joey?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: How do you think she's doing?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Am I the only one who doesn't think that she's hot? Ross?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Eh, I mean, I mena she's not unattractive but hot? I ....

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thank you!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Now that Rachel's gone?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So hot I cried myself to sleep last night.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey Mike, what's the capital of Peru?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Lima.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No. It starts with a "v" and ends with an "x". Helpfully with a "to" in the middle.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: You know, kinda think of it, the capital of Peru IS "vtox". Oh god! Oh!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: OK, I don't want to freak you out or anything, but I think I just saw a rat in your cupboard.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: What, is he your pet rat?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well not so much a pet as, you know, an occasional visitor who I put food out for, you know. Kinda like Santa. Except Santa doesn't poop on the plate of cookies.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: You can't keep a rat in your appartment! They're extremely unsanitary, and they transmit leptospirosis and hantavirus.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What are those?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: I don't know but they don't sound like spa treatments. You have to get rid of it!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: OK, fine, if it means that much to you I'll get rid of Bob.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So weird, you think he's so gross and you're willing to eat his crackers.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: Hello

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Gavin, I just wanted to say thank you again for watching Emma yesterday during the presentation. I really owe you an apology.

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, when we first met, you know, I thought you were pompous and arrogant and obnoxious ...

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: Is this your first apology?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, I just mean that, you know, first impressions don't mean anything. And I-I think you're a really good guy and I'm sorry that I misjudged you.

utterance.speaker: Heather
utterance.content: Good morning!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hello. But you know what, hey, new day, new leaf, I am just really really happy ... I'm sorry, obviously Heather's ass has something more important to say so I'll just wait 'till it's finished.

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I was giving you an apology and you were totally checking her out!

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: I wasn't checking her out. I'm in fashion, I was looking at her skirt. Or was it pants? I didn't really see what happened below the ass area.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh wow, you are really, you're really a creep.

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: Why do you even care if I was looking at her? Are you jealous?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yeah, I'm jealous. "Oh Gavin, please, please look at my ass". Stop looking at my ass! I mean, I just think you are totally inappropriate, ok? This is a work environment, she's your subordinate.

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: I thought it was ok when you slept with your old assistant Tag.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That is totally different for two reasons. One - I didn't know that you knew that. And two, I wasn't some creep staring at his ass, we had a deap meaningful relationship.

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: Huh. What's Tag's last name?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It was ... oh my god. He didn't have a last name. It was just "Tag". You know, like Cher, or, you know, Moses.

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: But it was a deap meaningful relationship.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, you know what - my first impression of you was absolutely right. You are arrogant, you are pompous ... Morgan! Morgan! Tag's last name was Morgan! Huh!

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: It was Jones.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah well what are you, his boyfriend?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Man, I wish I had a nanny like you.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: You mean, when you were a baby.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Would you stop staring at her?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I wasn't staring. I was leering.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What's the big deal with her? Maybe she's attractive in an obvious kind of way.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, obvious beauty's the worst. You know, when it's right there in your face. Me, I like to have to work to find someone attractive. Makes me feel like I earned it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Looks like Joey is doing allright with her.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah. Hey, that was nice of you guys to back off and let Joey get the girl for once.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ok, I'll be home right after work. Ok, by Emma-Wemma-Demma, I love you - wovyou dovyou ...

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: Bye

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: They've elected me to talk to you about the baby talk - it's not so good.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: I think it's sweet.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Because it took us months to find a good nanny and I wouldn't want anything to, you know, drive her away.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So, what, you think I'm just gonna sleep with her and never call her again and things are gonna get uncomfortable? Yeah, sounds about right.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Come on, there are plenty of other women out thereok? Just - just forget about her, ok? Just, she's off limits.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, man, why did have to go and say that for? Now that you told me I can't have it makes me want her even more!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What are you, a child?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Joey, come on now, for me! Please, just-just try to focus your sexual energy on someone else.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey Mikey

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Hey P

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Setting rat traps.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: To kill Bob??

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: No, no, to test his neck strength.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, Mike, I don't want to kill him! I thought we were just gonna capture him and, and you know, set him free in the country side where he can maybe meet a friendly possum and a wisecracking owl.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Ok, ok, I'll throw away the traps.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I'll find Bob, I'll get him. Bob? Bob! Robert! Oh wait, I think I hear him. Oh - Oh my god! Bob had babies! Bob's a mom!

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Better think of a new name for him.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I don't know, I kinda like Bob for a girl.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: I don't know, I mean I'm not sure ...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my god, we killed Bob!

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Maybe it wasn't Bob, maybe it was a mouse.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Suzie?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Seriously dude, 3 years ago.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Listen, can you do me a favor? I'm gonna be out today. Can you just keep an eye on Joey, make sure nothing happens between him and Molly?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You don't trust him?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wh - No. Some woman who sounded a lot like Joey called earlier and asked for her daughter, the "hot nanny".

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Is this really your long term plan, for me to run interference? Because I could get a job any day now.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You do appear right on the cusp of something. Come on man, I'm sure he'll lose interest in a week or two, but for now can you please just do this for me?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, fine, but don't blame me if it doesn't work. Because you know as well as I do that once Joey sets his mind on something, more often than not, he's going to have sex with it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well we gotta do something, ok? Nannies like her don't grow on trees.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Picturing that tree?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I am, yes.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Where you going, Joe?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: For a walk.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh. You mind if I join you?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Actually, that will be long. You know, I really need to organize my thoughts.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Your thoughts? Plural?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, fine, I only have one thought! It's about the hot nanny, I gotta see her!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'm afraid I can't let you do that, Joe.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Now YOU'RE telling me I can't see her?? You guys are killing me! She's forbidden fruit! It's like ... like she's the princess and I'm the stable boy ... Why are you doing this, huh? Did Ross tell you not to let me go over there?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, as a matter of fact he did, so I can't let you go.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Huh. Interesting. Now there are obstacles. Hot nanny and me against the world. This is the kind of stuff great novels are made of.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Great novels?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Fine ... mediocre porn

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: Gavin Mitchelle's office.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Rachel Green's office!! Give me that phone! Hello, this is Rachel Green, how can I help you? Uh huh ... ok then ... I'll pass you back to your son

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: Hey Mom! No, that's just my secretary.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Um, excuse me Gavin, I have a question I need to ask you.

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: Mom, I'll call you later. Yeah. Yes?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: If you like looking at butts so much why don't you just go look at a mirror?

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: Thank god you finally said that, I saw you make a note on your pad three hours ago. Man, I really bug you, don't I?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, please, I don't care about you enough to bug me. In fact, from now on, I'm going take the high road. And I'm going be very very nice to you, you "momma's boy", starting right now.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey Rach!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ready for your birthday lunch?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah I am, I am! Oh, but first of all, Monica, I would like to introduce you to my very talented colleague and more importantly my wonderful friend Gavin Mitchelle.

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: Pleased to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Pleased to meet you. So you're coming to Rachel's party tonight?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh no no no no no, Gavin can't, he already has plans, most likely with his mother.

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: Well I don't mind, I'll cancel. I would never miss my secretary's birthday.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why did you invite him?? I can't stand that guy!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You were just being so nice to him!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I was faking it! Can't you tell when I'm being fake?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey, Mr Philips, nice suit!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Right there! That was so fake!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Shh!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, you're welcome for the party. I'm glad you're having a good time.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: God, I hope he doesn't show up. Of course he's not gonna show up, the guy hates me.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Does he?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Maybe he's bothering you so much because he likes you. It's like in first grade when Skippy Langwild always pushed me on the playground because he secretly had a crush on me?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, Monica, you think Skippy liked you? Honey, all those buys had a bet to see if he can knock you over.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, ok, thank you. Do you see what all the guys see in her?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wouldn't kick her out of bed. No more Vodka for me!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Rach, so can I sing happy birthday to you now?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, sure!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh ... Happy birth ... oh, see you later

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey Rach, somebody got you shoes!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, give me!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Be careful, be careful! These are my rat babies!

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Yeah. We have rat babies now.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ahhhh , you brought rats to my birthday party?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So this is what a stroke feels like.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I had to bring them! We killed their mother, they're our responsibility now. You know, they require constant care. You should know that, Rachel, you're a mother.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Are you comparing my daughter to a rat?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No! Seven rats! I think we should take them home, we need feed them.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: whhh wait, you're gonna leave my party to take care of a box of rats?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well I'm sorry Rachel, but I'm not like you, ok? Not everyone can afford help.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Where the hell are Joey and Molly? I asked you to watch them.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: We have to stop them before something happens!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So you see, Molly, what people don't understand is that acting is a discipline. It takes a lot of hard work.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: So where did you study?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, I didn't go to college.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: No, where did you study acting?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Molly ... people don't study acting ...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Molly, ah, do you mind giving us just a minute?

utterance.content: Sure, I'll go check on Emma.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What do you think you're gonna do, have sex with her right here on my couch?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No ... the leather sticks to my ass. You know, this isn't fair. What makes you think that I'm just gonna sleep with her and then blow her off? Huh? Can't you guys open your minds to the possibility that I actally like her, and might want something real? Look, the truth is, I haven't felt this way about anyone since Rachel, ok? I didn't think I could ever love again.

utterance.speaker: Ross and Chandler
utterance.content: Come on! Joe!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ok

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Hi, is Molly here?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, come on in. Molly?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ok ... Well, uh, Joey, I guess we have no problem.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It's like my favorite fairy tale come true! The princess, the stable boy and the lesbian!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ok, ok, you start preparing the formula and I start changing the box and then we gotta put them straight to bed.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Hey, when did we become one of those couples whose lives revolve around their rats?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, you know what, they're our responsibility now.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Ok, fine, these rats are our responsibility. What happens when they mate and there are hundreds of them?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Mate? They're all brothers and sisters.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Yeah - not such a problem with rats. No, they're more of a "love the one you're with" kind of animals.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No. wh - get off your sister! Oh my god, what are we gonna do? We have 7 rats. So what if each of them has 7 rats? And then each of those have 7 rats? That's like ... That's math I can't even do! What are we gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Well, I know this is gonna sound crazy, but, we could not let the box of rats ruin our lives.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, ok. I guess you're right. All right, so we should just give them away. But to nice families, with children, and reduced fat wheat thins. They're Bob's favorites.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: It's gonna be ok.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You must think I'm crazy.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: No, I think you're sweet.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Good. It's just so hard, it's hard for me to ... let them go. I guess it just brings back memories, you know, from ... when I gave birth to my brother's triplets and I had to give them up. I haven't told you about that yet, have I?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi. Thanks for the party, honey. Should I help you clean up?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No way! You had your party, now I have mine! Is everything alright?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, I just get a little bummed when my birthday's over.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, at least you have one thing to be happy about. That jerk Gavin from your office didn't show up .

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Mmm hmm.

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: Yeah, hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, we weren't talking about you. No, no way to recover.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: Nice party.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, it was, and you would have seen it if you didn't showed up at ... 9:30?? God! Oh, this party was lame ...

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: Look, I'll just give you this and go.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, you bought me a present! Why?

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: Well, let me explain how birthday parties usually work. There are presents, and a cake, perhaps a fourth or fifth person. Ok, I ... got you the present to make up for being such a jerk to you earlier.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Aww. Well, ok, well that's very nice. And you wrote a card . "From Gavin"

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: I really mean it.

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: You don't mind? Well, what do you know, it fits!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: See, Gavin, you're capable of being a nice guy. Why did you give me such a hard time?

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: I'm not sure.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well Monica seems to think it's because you have feelings for me.

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: I do have feelings for you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You do?

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: Yes, I feel that you are a little annoying.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: See? Why, Gavin, why? Right when I'm about to change my opinion of you, you go and you ... and you do that ...

utterance.content: Listen, I think I've left something here.

utterance.content: Oh, well someone left this . This is yours?

utterance.content: Oh, uh, well, I haven't seem it but if I do I'll let you know.
